a passionate programmer and problem-solver. 
 
Specialities:

- 2+ years of enterprise data architecture

 Experience Technical Team Lead Platalytics, Inc. January 2014  – Present (1 year 7 months) Pakistan Worked on next version of Platalytics's big data analytics platform, it replaced Apache Hadoop with Apache Spark as a core processing framework  
 
- Implemented new workflow execution strategies to execute jobs on MapReduce, Yarn and Apache Spark 
 
- Added support of streaming data for Apache Kafka and Kinesis using Apache Spark Streaming 
 
- Worked with a team to add new data sources support like Cassandra, Kafka, HTTP; added new set of transformations like tagging, different join types; added support for adhoc query using Hive, Spark SQL and Phoenix; added new analytics algorithms using Mlib  
 
- Worked with a team to implement real time monitoring of clusters, hosts, services (like HDFS, MR, Hbase, Zookeeper, Spark, Oozie etc ) and Spark applications using Ganglia and OpenTsdb 
 Technical Team Lead Platalytics, Inc. October 2013  –  December 2013  (3 months) Pakistan Worked on a customer project to process traffic time series data 
 
- Data was ingested from Amazon S3 
 
- Time series calculations were done to compute different stats like traffic congestion, index and speed analysis for different sectors of roads for 7 european countries for 1.5 years worth of data 
 
- There were about 300 thousand road sectors and about 300,000 billion records 
 
- Exposed REST API's for data retrieval 
 Technical Team Lead Platalytics, Inc. April 2012  –  September 2013  (1 year 6 months) Pakistan Implemented Apache Hadoop based big data analytics platform to ingest, process, index and visualize batch data . From inception, design, architecture and implementation, completed all the phases on my own at the backend side. 
 
Main modules of platform: 
 
- Implemented workflow DAG (Directed Acyclic Graph) of jobs using Oozie and exposed REST API's to manage workflows 
 
- Implemented ingestion layer to fetch data from NoSQL databases like Hbase, MongoDb, Relational databases like MySql, Oracle(Using Sqoop), from different log files (Using Flume), Amazon S3, from HDFS (using Apache Camel) and from other sources 
 
- Implemented processing layer to compute different aggregations (like min, max, moving averages, counts, time series calculations), filtering based on expressions, different transformations (like encryption, mathematical formulas support, compressions, data cleansing), joining different sets of data. This module was based on Apache Hadoop MapReduce jobs 
 
- Implemented an analytics module to add support for Clustering, Classification, Recommendation and Pattern Matching by using Mahout 
 
- Implemented data storage layer using Hbase 
 
- Added support for data indexing using Solr and Elastic search 
 
- Implemented REST API's to expose analytics data for every stage 
 Software Engineer Platalytics, Inc. October 2011  –  March 2012  (6 months) Pakistan Worked on a number of small projects  
 
- Worked on a project KMS for a telecom sector, implemented Google Maps based visualisations, worked on business reports and alert modules.  
Technologies Used: CakePHP, JavaScript, MySql  
 
- Implemented mobile application for KMS using Sencha touch and PhoneGap 
Technologies Used: Sencha touch, ExtJs 
 
- Worked on front end part of big data platform and implemented its basic architecture 
Technologies Used: Node Js, Express Js, MongoDb  
 
 Software Engineer Lahore University of Management Sciences September 2007  –  December 2007  (4 months) Pakistan Implemented an e-learning system for a Saudi Arabian call center as a project of Distributed Software System Development course in LUMS. It helped call center trainers to train new employees by using a set of tools provided in the e-learning system. 
 
- Implemented video conferencing feature using Flash Media Server. Both one to one (trainer to trainee) and one to many (trainer to many trainees) video conference was possible. 
 
- Group chat feature, helps trainer and trainees to communicate with each other using text chat 
 
- Real time drawing feature, helps trainer to convey thoughts using a white board 
 
Technologies: Adobe Flex, Flash Media Server, Action Script

Summary o Awarded as the Best Technical Lead of the year 2013 and Best Business Analyst of the year 2014 in Rolustech, with overall 5+ years of experience in development of Web & Enterprise applications using JavaScript, PHP and MySQL Technologies on various applications including CRM for different sectors like Banking, Medical, Insurance, Lawyer Consultancy and Teaching etc… 
o Working with Rolustech Pvt. LTD Pakistan (http://www.rolustech.com) from Nov 2009 till date. 
o Working in an agile methodology for the development of SugarCRM based projects. My responsibilities include (and are not limited to) that of Scrum Master, Technical Team Lead and Solution Architect. I design and assign tasks to the team members, get updates in scrum meetings daily and make sure everything goes on track.

o Knowledge of Redmine, Assembla, Jira, Confluence, and Trello tool for the management of projects. 
o Cohesive team worker, having strong Analytical, Business Analysis, Architectural Design, Communication Skill, Problem solving and Interpersonal skills.

Front end is built with MVC4 on a Web Role and secured by custom Authorization via WAAD connected to an Office 365 tenant. Data is provided in two different ways: CRUD screens (with Slickgrid) and import (by using ExcelDataReader), and is validated by a custom DataAnnotations framework.  
 
Input is dispatched via a Queue and processed/calculated by a Worker Role to decouple front end from data intensive tasks/high workload.  
 
Final results are two reports: a Reporting Service report (served by a Report Viewer in the front end) and a PowerPivot report. 
 
Technologies: Windows Azure (WAAD, SQL Server, Table Storage, Queues, Team Foundation Service, Reporting Services, Web Roles, Worker Roles, Virtual Machines), .NET 4.5, C#, MVC4, EF5, DataAnnotations, PowerPivot, jQuery, SlickGrid, ExcelDataReader, JSON, Bootstrap

Methodologies: Agile Lead Developer / Team Lead D.E MASTER BLENDERS 1753 February 2013  –  October 2013  (9 months) Amsterdam Area, Netherlands Recreating the Enterprise-wide Pricing and Trading Allowance System (Eptas) business application, using the latest technologies of the Windows Azure technology stack, developing on Windows Azure VM's and using TFS for Continuous Integration.  
 
Front end is built with MVC4 on a Web Role and secured by custom Authorization via WAAD connected to an Office 365 tenant. Data is provided in two different ways: CRUD screens (with Slickgrid) and import (by using ExcelDataReader), and is validated by a custom DataAnnotations framework.  
 
Input is dispatched via a Queue and processed/calculated by a Worker Role to decouple front end from data intensive tasks/high workload.  
 
Final results are two reports: a Reporting Service report (served by a Report Viewer in the front end) and a PowerPivot report. 
 
Technologies: Windows Azure (WAAD, SQL Server, Table Storage, Queues, Team Foundation Service, Reporting Services, Web Roles, Worker Roles, Virtual Machines), .NET 4.5, C#, MVC4, EF5, DataAnnotations, PowerPivot, jQuery, SlickGrid, ExcelDataReader, JSON, Bootstrap 
Tasks: Team Lead, Lead Developer

Methodologies: Agile Lead Developer NOvAA/Nederlandse Beroepsorganisatie van Accountants (NBA) April 2011  –  September 2012  (1 year 6 months) Amsterdam Area, Netherlands NBA is the merger of NOvAA and NIVRA (Dutch Accountants associations).  
 
Defining the architectural landscape for the current and future websites of NBA , implementation, team lead. 
 
Implemented using EPiServer CMS 6 R2. 
Sites are HTML5 and CSS3 compliant. 
Page types defined via PageTypeBuilder. 
All images via EPiImage (like carrousel, images in content etc). 
Dynamic Content which can be used by Content Editors to add extra information/functionalities. 
Use of Pro6PP web service to leverage address and geographic functionalities. 
Created architectural guidelines for exchanging data between NBA and the web sites. 
 
 
NBA.nl 
Corporate presence website .  
Mapping POX web services using AutoMapper. 
Using jQuery and various plugins to provide a rich user experience. 
 
MijnNBA.nl + MijnStagebureau.nl 
Corporate membership website.  
Custom authentication and authorization, using custom ASP.NET Membership and Role Providers. 
Mapping POX web services using AutoMapper. 
Enabling back office forms via a custom proxy. 
 
NBAOpleidingen.nl + NBAVRC.nl 
Website containing the courses portfolio for accountants. Visitors can register for available courses. 
SSIS imports data from an external database (via flat files) and creates a new database which can be used to retrieve the necessary data. 
Used EF 4.1 to interact with the courses database, via custom entities and the fluent API. 
Used Json, PURE and jQuery for a rich, fast and interactive way to view and filter the courses. 
Custom authentication and authorization, using custom ASP.NET Membership and Role Providers. 
Mapping POX web services using AutoMapper. 
Using a shared codebase to prevent double code and maximise re-use and a stable, extendable and easy to maintain codebase. 
 
AccountantWorden.nl 
Campaign presence website 
Implementing a rich design 
Aggregated data views 
 
Technologies: EPiServer CMS, ASP.NET, C#, EF 4.1, jQuery, JSON, Google Maps API v3, HTML5

Goal is to improve the quality and coverage of diverse points of interest on Google Maps. Representing EMEA & LATAM while liaising with Senior Management as well as external teams in Mountain View, Hyderabad, Beijing, New York. 
 
ACCOMPLISHMENTS INCLUDE 
- Conceptualized, set up, trained, staffed, analyzed, summarized and presented results of over 150 projects globally 
- Conceptualized and rolled out new methods to track operator’s quality and productivity in these projects increasing output quality by ~7% 
- Increased staffing efficiency and effectiveness through the creation of database dashboards, project trackers and staffing check-ins, liaising with 20 Team Leads in Dublin 
- Played vital part in increasing site quality from ~92% to +98% 
- Contributed to site culture through creating videos and events 
 
PROJECTS SET UP AND LED 
- New global CSAT program increasing call quality for our 1.5k HC strong operation, implemented in LDO metrics 
- Strategic sweeps to tackle identified issues: 1.3k listings with identical map location in Ireland, 300 hospitals in Turkey, 950 governmental listings in Belgium 
- Dublin's portion of data collection and - verification of over 1k global Prominent Places 
- Verification of 21k strategic listings in Turkey, Argentina and Poland increasing location and address accuracy by 70% and over 40% improvement of other attributes such as title and phone number 
- 5k+ relevant business listings ahead of the 2014 FIFA World Cup in Brazil, increasing quality to over 98% 
- ‘Mixed Edits’ operations: responsible for daily worksheets, reporting on progress, follow up with technical and policy issues, weekly meetings 
- 'Indoor' operations: created a new workflow aimed at creation and updating of POIs inside top level business listings such as shopping malls and airports (Open) 3 recommendations, including: Sean Higgins Marin Software - App Supp Manager EMEA Paul has great attention to detail and is very organised. Local Data Evaluator Google April 2013  –  March 2014  (1 year) Dublin Evaluated Google Maps data for the Dutch and Belgian market, as well as high profile listings around the world. 
To insure the best Google Maps user experience possible, accurate and complete data is critical.  
My job was to review data from different inputs and to verify and complete it using various sources with great attention to detail in a target driven international environment.  
 
- Highest performer on site in 2 months’ time, consistently exceeded challenging daily targets of 60+ listings with a quality score of above 98% 
- Analysed data in order to identify trends and inconsistencies in organisation policy; for example, constantly monitored error rate on specific attributes, identifying training needs and possible system bugs Webmaster Jeff Les Pins July 2012  –  January 2013  (7 months) Developed the new trilingual website for holiday resort Jeff Les Pins, based on the Wordpress framework and with Google Analytics integration. Aside from adapting the WordPress-framework to the customer’s needs, I developed a custom CMS to intuitively handle the data in custom made databases. 
It is now a successful online platform for buying and selling forests, with a turn around of over 300 forests (beginning of 2015), 100+ unique visitors a day from 15+ countries. Summary Reza Jan is an accomplished political risk and intelligence analyst whose work is informed by a combination of on-the-ground experience in hostile environments, subject matter expertise, and an extensive and influential contact network that stretches from the U.S., across North Africa and the Gulf, to South Asia. 
 
He specializes in conducting open-source intelligence (OSINT) and data analysis, including through the use of intelligence and data platforms such as Palantir, and is a subject matter expert on political and security issues relating to South and Central Asia and North Africa.  
 
Reza has briefed top former executive branch leaders, intelligence officials, four-star generals, sitting senators and representatives, senior hill staffers, and World Bank and IMF officials on various issues relating to South Asia, ranging from security issues and military operations to the economy and social media penetration.  
 
He has also trained and briefed U.S. military, intelligence and law-enforcement personnel on insurgent groups and organized crime in Pakistan and has been consulted by numerous corporate entities, including Fortune 500 companies, on security concerns and the investment environment in Pakistan. 
 
Reza has published dozens of articles and reports, including in such journals as the New York Times and Foreign Policy, and has been interviewed and quoted by media outlets such as the Washington Post, Wall Street Journal, BBC, Reuters, Fox News, the Daily Beast, and Al Jazeera English, among others.  
 
Reza is currently an analyst at AEI's Critical Threats Project where he serves as the Pakistan Team Lead. He also serves as the Afghanistan Team Lead at CTP's sister think tank, the Institute for the Study of War, and has previously led CTP's Libya Team. Experience Critical Threats Project Analyst and Pakistan Team Lead American Enterprise Institute October 2009  – Present (5 years 10 months) Washington D.C. Metro Area •	Lead research and analysis for the Critical Threats Project’s (CTP) Pakistan team. Direct Pakistan team and manage website. 
•	Write articles analyzing regional security issues including: U.S.-Pakistan relations; regional terrorism and security; the Pakistani military; Pakistani energy and economic issues; domestic politics. 
•	Maintain robust U.S. and Pakistani contact network including senior military officers, diplomats, journalists, government officials, aid workers and businessmen.

App Description:  
To develop separate diagnostic and configuration applications for the Android devices that can be used to interface with the RBC Flash UI Board. The applications will not connect to the EPC ECM Motor through a wired connection. There will be a wireless module connected to the RBC Flash UI Board through which a Wi-Fi connection can be established with the applications.  
 
Role & Contribution: 
• Lead a team of 4 developers 
• Engineered the application using the latest Android SDK, Google Maps API’s and advanced UX and UI design  
• Developed custom and compound views for elegant user-interface  
• Communication with the backend server database using RESTful Http web services with efficient data-parsing technique implementation using JSON/GSON and XML 
• Smooth synchronization of the remote database with the local SQLite database for viewing offline data 
• Proficient use of external libraries like Volley, Picasso for performing faster networking 
• Implementing Push Notification frameworks like GCM for transmitting information to the registered users 
• Perform TDD and BDD using Robolectric and Robotium 
• Agile methodology for project management 
• Managed continuous code management using GIT 
• Work closely with the Mobile Product Management teams to prioritize additional product features

 iOS Developer L&T Infotech September 2012  –  December 2012  (4 months) Mumbai Area, India App Description:  
The App is targeted towards controlling the Recloser, which is mounted over power supply lines. It will also be capturing the data from the Recloser. The application will communicate with a Wifly shield over an adhoc open Wi-Fi network created by the Wifly shield. The Wifly shield in turn will communicate with the Recloser over UART. The app will send data to Wifly shield by creating a TCP/IP socket connection and wifly will push the data to the Recloser over UART. 
 
Role & Contribution: 
• Developed and implemented this application using iPhone SDK, XCode, interface builder using objective C  
• Implemented the application working with a fully customized UI using the UIKit Framework 
• Implemented Core Metrics to gather user statistics for marketing optimization 
• Participate in the design and development of APIs 
• Implemented line and bar chart for logged data analysis using core graph 
• Created category of UIviewcontroller for dynamic UI updates 
• Beta testing of the application using Test flight 
• Conducted memory management tests using Instruments and Static Analyzer 
• Translated Key functionality (iOS code) into Android to streamline Android production

• Implemented Google Maps SDK for displaying the registered users and the nearby available taxis 
• Developed application using the Agile Software development methodology 
• Managed ongoing maintenance to fix bugs, add features and functionalities

• Collaborate with Product team, UI Designers, product operations and marketing to develop and deliver path breaking projects and apps

Summary Having a very varied work history to date, my most recent experience working with Google Maps (via CPL) strengthened my leadership, communication and project management skills.  
Hired as a Local Data Quality Evaluator I quickly progressed onto several other roles within my team including Quality Control, Dispute Analyst and Mentor. Later promoted to a Team Lead position leading a team of 20-30 operators and Senior Team Lead back-up overlooking a team of 70-80 operators.  
 
Graduated with a 2.1 BA (Hons) in Social Care - this education taught me expertise understanding in the areas of community, family and youth work as well as mental health, children with challenging behaviour, older people, people with drug issues, homelessness and disabilities. 
Through my hands-on work experience in the mental health, family work, disability and youth work sector I grew professional communication and people skills with a passion for helping those in need showing continuous empathy and compassion. 
 
My experience working in the customer service sector in various shops and cafes built up my skills in delivering the highest standard of customer service, professionally dealing with customer complaints and quickly building customer relations.
